utils module

class utils.DataGenerator(project_root_path='../../../', platform='CW305_IBEX', state_file='data_generator_state.json')

Bases: ProjectBaseClass

DataGenerator handle data and label generation for the software running on the Ibex softcore.

This class manages the build process, data generation, and labeling for software targets, keeping track of state to avoid redundant operations.

__init__(project_root_path='../../../', platform='CW305_IBEX', state_file='data_generator_state.json')

Initialize the DataGenerator

Parameters:

  • src_dir (str) – Source directory containing software folders

  • platform (str) – Target platform for compilation

  • state_file (str) – File to store/load state information

Captures trace between trigger_high and trigger_low

Parameters:

  • software_name (str) – Name of the software

  • softcore (IbexChipWhisperer) – Softcore on which to run and debug the software

_run_gdb_command_efficient(gdb, cmd, max_timeout=30, verbose=False)

Run a GDB command and proceed as soon as the prompt returns. Only waits as long as necessary, up to max_timeout.

Parameters:

  • softcore (IbexChipWhisperer) – Softcore on which to run and debug the software

Returns:

class utils.DataSynthesizer(project_root_path='../../../', allowed_instructions=None)

Bases: ProjectBaseClass

Class for synthesizing data and creating C files for Ibex-related operations. Inherits from ProjectBaseClass to leverage common path handling and utility functions.

__init__(project_root_path='../../../', allowed_instructions=None)

Initialize the DataSynthesizer class with project root path.

Parameters:

project_root_path (str) – Path to the project root directory

extend_corpus(num_instructions, num_new_files, prefix='isg')

Generate more .c files containing random RISCV32IMC assembly instructions. All new softwares are named according to the convention: isg_<NUM_INSTRUCTIONS>_<ID>

Parameters:

  • num_instructions (int) – (approximate) number of ASM instructions per file

  • num_new_files (int) – number of new files to generate

  • prefix (str) – name prefix for each of the created softwares

Returns:

Success status of the generation

Return type:

bool

Raises:

pass –

gen_c_file(software_name, num_instructions, overwrite=False, allow_nop_fill=False)

Create a .c file in the appropriate directory for the specified software.

Parameters:

  • software_name (str) – Name of the software

  • num_instructions (int) – (approximate) number of ASM instructions to generate

  • overwrite (bool) – Whether to overwrite an existing file (default: False)

Returns:

Path to the created C file

Return type:

str

Raises:

  • FileExistsError – If the file already exists and overwrite is False

  • ValueError – If the software_name is invalid

genDatasetFairseq(dataset_dict, name='dataset', manifest_dir=None)

Generate a dataset for Fairseq’s FileTraceDataset by arranging directory structure and creating manifest.

This method: 1. Creates partition directories as specified in dataset_dict 2. Copies trace files to appropriate locations 3. Creates manifest files with batch information including trace paths, program labels, and trace lengths

Parameters:

  • dataset_dict (dict) – Dictionary mapping partition names (e.g., ‘train’, ‘test’) to lists of software names to include in each partition

  • name (str) – Name of the dataset

  • manifest_dir (str) – The base directory for manifests

Returns:

None

Side effects:

  • Creates directories for each partition

  • Copies trace NPY files to appropriate locations

  • Creates manifest JSON files for each partition

gen_labels(force=False)

Generate and save instruction labels for each software.

Creates two files for each software in its respective directory: - debug_instr.txt: Contains only instruction names, one per line - debug_instr_reg.txt: Contains instructions with their registers/operands, one per line

If a file already exists, it will be skipped unless force=True.

Parameters:

force (bool, optional) – If True, overwrite existing files. Defaults to False.

Returns:

None

generateVocab(labels, out_dir)

labels: list of strings, labels to generate vocab from out_path: str, path to the directory to write vocab file to

Writes vocab.txt file to disk

get_instruction_distribution()

Get the aggregate count of each instruction across all software.

Returns:

Two lists (instruction_names, counts) sorted by count in descending order

Return type:

tuple

get_raw_labels(software_name=None, source='gdb')

Get raw instruction data for specified software or all software.

Parameters:

  • software_name (str, optional) – Name of the software to get labels for. If None, gets labels for all software.

  • source (str) – Data source - ‘gdb’ or ‘spike’

Returns:

Dictionary of raw labels for all software or string for specific software

Return type:

dict or str

get_trace_counts()

Returns:

List of tuples (software_name, trace_count) sorted by count in descending order

Return type:

list

Returns:

Return type:

dict or numpy.ndarray

Parse instruction logs into structured instruction data.

  • source (str) – Data source - ‘gdb’ or ‘spike’

Returns:

Return type:

dict or list

wavWrite(fpath, trace_path)

Convert and write a trace file to WAV format.

Parameters:

  • trace_path (str) – Path to .npy np.array trace file to convert

Returns:

Duration of the trace in seconds

Return type:

float

Side effects:

Writes trace to disk as a .wav file

class utils.IbexChipWhisperer(project_root_path='../../../', oversampling_factor=4)

Bases: ProjectBaseClass

Class to manage ChipWhisperer operations with Ibex RISC-V core. Handles FPGA programming, firmware loading, and debugging operations with CW305 Artix-7 FPGA.

__init__(project_root_path='../../../', oversampling_factor=4)

Initialize the IbexChipWhisperer controller.

Parameters:

  • ibex_base_path (str) – Path to the Ibex demo system repository

  • oversampling_rate (int) – Oversampling rate = sampling frequency / softcore clock frequency

connect()

Connect to the ChipWhisperer measurement device and set up the scope and target.

disconnect()

Disconnect from the ChipWhisperer device.

program_fpga(bitstream='lowrisc_ibex_demo_system_512KRAM.bit', prog_speed=10000000.0)

Program the FPGA with the specified bitstream.

Parameters:

  • bitstream (str) – Name of the bitstream file to program

  • prog_speed (float) – Programming speed

Returns:

True if programming was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

reload(program_path, debug=False, verbose=True)

Reset the device and load a program.

Parameters:

  • program_path (str) – Path to the program to load

  • debug (bool) – If True, halt after loading (await debugger)

  • verbose (bool) – If True, print verbose output

Returns:

Result of the load operation

Return type:

subprocess.CompletedProcess
